page.title: 03Religion
page.content: {The parish church of St.Mary Magdalene stands in the centre of the village. It was rebuilt in 1855 only the tower remaining of the original 14th century building.This houses a full peal of 8 bells which are rung every Sunday. There are two brasses on the north wall of the chancel dating back to 1380,and a central chandelier dated 1770.Sunday services are at 8a.m. and 10.30a.m.,average attendances being approximately 12 at 8 and 40 at 10.30. The priest in charge is also an assistant curate at Roffey.The church is surrounded by a churchyard containing many old graves,many of the headstones being illegible.There is no other place of worship of any denomination in the village of Rusper.
